verses.verse: (Impending Judgment on Israel and Judah) “Hear this, O priests! Take heed, O house of Israel! Give ear, O house of the king! For yours is the judgment, Because (Hos. 6:9) you have been a snare to Mizpah And a net spread on Tabor.
The revolters are (Is. 29:15; Hos. 4:2; 6:9) deeply involved in slaughter, Though I rebuke them all.
(Amos 3:2; 5:12) I know Ephraim, And Israel is not hidden from Me; For now, O Ephraim, (Hos. 4:17) you commit harlotry; Israel is defiled.
“They do not direct their deeds Toward turning to their God, For (Hos. 4:12) the spirit of harlotry is in their midst, And they do not know the LORD.
The (Hos. 7:10) pride of Israel testifies to his face; Therefore Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity; Judah also stumbles with them.
“With their flocks and herds (Prov. 1:28; Is. 1:15; Jer. 11:11; Ezek. 8:18; Mic. 3:4; John 7:34) They shall go to seek the LORD, But they will not find Him; He has withdrawn Himself from them.
They have (Is. 48:8; Jer. 3:20; Hos. 6:7) dealt treacherously with the LORD, For they have begotten pagan children. Now a New Moon shall devour them and their heritage.
“Blow (Hos. 8:1; Joel 2:1) the ram’s horn in Gibeah, The trumpet in Ramah! (Is. 10:30) Cry aloud at (Josh. 7:2) Beth Aven, ‘Look behind you, O Benjamin!’
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke; Among the tribes of Israel I make known what is sure.
“The princes of Judah are like those who (Deut. 19:14; 27:17) remove a landmark; I will pour out My wrath on them like water.
Ephraim is (Deut. 28:33) oppressed and broken in judgment, Because he willingly walked by (Mic. 6:16) human precept.
Therefore I will be to Ephraim like a moth, And to the house of Judah (Prov. 12:4) like rottenness.

“When Ephraim saw his sickness, And Judah saw his (Jer. 30:12-15) wound, Then Ephraim went (2 Kin. 15:19; Hos. 7:11; 10:6) to Assyria And sent to King Jareb; Yet he cannot cure you, Nor heal you of your wound.

For (Ps. 7:2; Lam. 3:10; Hos. 13:7, 8) I will be like a lion to Ephraim, And like a young lion to the house of Judah. (Ps. 50:22) I, even I, will tear them and go away; I will take them away, and no one shall rescue.
I will return again to My place Till they acknowledge their offense. Then they will seek My face; In their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”
